div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.h1: Character Education Word of the Week

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: At the end of May, the Public Schools of Robeson County will have virtual graduation ceremonies that contain all of the elements of a traditional graduation. We all hope that the alternate plans will allow graduates to celebrate their great achievements even if it is not the commencement that graduates, their families, and their friends were looking forward to. As plans are solidified and details become available, they will be shared by your high school. Details will also be provided on our website and social media.

High School Principals are actively planning for the upcoming virtual graduation and will be communicating those plans with stakeholders in the next few days. A Blackboard Connect message will be sent to our seniors on Thursday, April 30 with more details.

a.title: Go to comments for PSRC 2020 Graduations

span.p: Please fill out the attached Google Form with your student's up-to-date address. Having an accurate address will be beneficial to the district in the event we have to send certain materials to your home.

a.title: Go to comments for PSRC Contact Information Update

span.h3: Submit an application for your child to attend Title I Pre-K during the 2020-2021 school year. Children must be four years old by August 31, 2020 to be eligible.

a.title: Go to comments for Title I Pre-K Intent

p.em: ANY Child or young adult ages 1-18

ul.li: Fairmont High School (front drive at the cafeteria entrance)

span.p: All sites are drive-thru sites only. Parents may pull up to the designated area and a SN employee will provide the number of meals needed. Parents are asked to stay in their cars. Adult Meal will be A LA CARTE pricing.

a.title: Go to comments for Robeson County Schools Nutrition will offer FREE To-Go meals to ANY Child

span.p: The North Carolina Department of Public Instruction (NCDPI) has recently notified school districts that effective January 1, 2020, all school districts will be required to submit the personal information related to drug and alcohol testing of all employees who hold a Commercial Driver's License (CDL) to the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA) Drug and Alcohol Clearinghouse. Additional information regarding the FMCSA Drug and Alcohol Clearinghouse can be found at https://clearinghouse.fmcsa.dot.gov/FAQ

a.title: Go to comments for Commercial Driver’s License (CDL)
Go to comments for High School Registration Guide 2020-2021

strong.a: Speak Up Research Project for Digital Learning

a.title: Go to comments for Speak Up Research Project for Digital Learning
Go to comments for Op-out Form

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: As part of the Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA), each year the district is required to evaluate the content and effectiveness of the District Parent Involvement Policy with meaningful involvement of parents.
If you would like to provide comments and/or suggestions, please click here for the online feedback form.

a.title: 2020-2021 Student Transfer Application Deadline: Due April 1, 2019
You must register via phone before you can access the system 910.816.1822 Access ID & PIN are required
State Advisory Council on Indian Education (SACIE) Report

li.a: State Advisory Council on Indian Education (SACIE) Report

img.title: Welcome to the TumbleBookLibrary

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.title: Go to comments for A Statement From Our Superintendent

img.alt: School Rentals and Use of all Facilities will be Discontinued Until Further Notice

a.span: School Rentals and Use of all Facilities will be Discontinued Until Further Notice

div.p: To slow the spread of the Coronavirus and safeguard the well-being of our students and staff, the Public Schools of Robeson County (PSRC) has suspended normal operations until further notice.

a.title: Go to comments for School Rentals and Use of all Facilities will be Discontinued Until Further Notice

img.alt: A shelter in place order for North Carolina will begin Monday, March 30 at 5:00 pm

a.span: A shelter in place order for North Carolina will begin Monday, March 30 at 5:00 pm

div.p: As you know, a shelter in place order for North Carolina will begin Monday, March 30 at 5:00 pm to slow or stop the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19). For the first time in our lives, we’re all facing the need to stay at home for days and perhaps even weeks. This is an ever-evolving situation and we are dedicated to making sure students remain healthy and engaged during this prolonged closure of school buildings.

a.title: Go to comments for A shelter in place order for North Carolina will begin Monday, March 30 at 5:00 pm
